Package com.github.tommyettinger.anim8

Class AnimatedGif

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.AnimatedGif
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnimationWriter, Dithered
    public class AnimatedGif
extends java.lang.Object
implements AnimationWriter, Dithered
    Based on Nick Badal's Android port ( https://github.com/nbadal/android-gif-encoder/blob/master/GifEncoder.java ) of Alessandro La Rossa's J2ME port ( http://www.jappit.com/blog/2008/12/04/j2me-animated-gif-encoder/ ) of this pure Java animated GIF encoder by Kevin Weiner ( http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/2D-Graphics-GUI/AnimatedGifEncoder.htm ). The original has no copyright asserted, so this file continues that tradition and does not assert copyright either.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered

      • write

        <<<<<<< HEAD 
        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames)
           throws java.io.IOException
        ======= 
        public void write(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames)
        Writes the given Pixmap values in frames, in order, to an animated GIF at file. Always writes at 30 frames per second, so if frames has less than 30 items, this animation will be under a second long.
        >>>>>>> master
        Specified by:
        write in interface AnimationWriter
        Parameters:
        file - the FileHandle to write to; should generally not be internal because it must be writable
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames that should all be the same size, to be written in order

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps)
        Writes the given Pixmap values in frames, in order, to an animated GIF at file. The resulting GIF will play back at fps frames per second.
        Specified by:
        write in interface AnimationWriter
        Parameters:
        file - the FileHandle to write to; should generally not be internal because it must be writable
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames that should all be the same size, to be written in order
        fps - how many frames (from frames) to play back per second

      • write

        public void write(java.io.OutputStream output,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps)
        Writes the given Pixmap values in frames, in order, to an animated GIF in the OutputStream output. The resulting GIF will play back at fps frames per second.
        Specified by:
        write in interface AnimationWriter
        Parameters:
        output - the OutputStream to write to; will not be closed by this method
        frames - an Array of Pixmap frames that should all be the same size, to be written in order
        fps - how many frames (from frames) to play back per second

      • getPalette

        public PaletteReducer getPalette()
        Gets the PaletteReducer this uses to lower the color count in an image. If the PaletteReducer is null, this should try to assign itself a PaletteReducer when given a new image.
        Specified by:
        getPalette in interface Dithered
        Returns:
        the PaletteReducer this uses; may be null

      • setPalette

        public void setPalette(PaletteReducer palette)
        Sets the PaletteReducer this uses to bring a high-color or different-palette image down to a smaller palette size. If palette is null, this should try to assign itself a PaletteReducer when given a new image.
        Specified by:
        setPalette in interface Dithered
        Parameters:
        palette - a PaletteReducer that is often pre-configured with a specific palette; null is usually allowed

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay​(int ms)
        Sets the delay time between each frame, or changes it for subsequent frames (applies to last frame added).
        Parameters:
        ms - int delay time in milliseconds

      • setDispose

        public void setDispose​(int code)
        Sets the GIF frame disposal code for the last added frame and any subsequent frames. Default is 0 if no transparent color has been set, otherwise 2.
        Parameters:
        code - int disposal code.

      • setRepeat

        public void setRepeat​(int iter)
        Sets the number of times the set of GIF frames should be played. Default is 1; 0 means play indefinitely. Must be invoked before the first image is added.
        Parameters:
        iter - int number of iterations.

      • isFlipY

        public boolean isFlipY()
        Returns true if the output is flipped top-to-bottom from the inputs (the default); otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the inputs are flipped on writing, false otherwise

      • setFlipY

        public void setFlipY​(boolean flipY)
        Sets whether this should flip inputs top-to-bottom (true, the default setting), or leave as-is (false).
        Parameters:
        flipY - true if this should flip inputs top-to-bottom when writing, false otherwise
      <<<<<<< HEAD =======

      • getDitherAlgorithm

        public Dithered.DitherAlgorithm getDitherAlgorithm()
        Gets the Dithered.DitherAlgorithm this is currently using.
        Specified by:
        getDitherAlgorithm in interface Dithered
        Returns:
        which dithering algorithm this currently uses.

      • setDitherAlgorithm

        public void setDitherAlgorithm(Dithered.DitherAlgorithm ditherAlgorithm)
        Sets the dither algorithm (or disables it) using an enum constant from Dithered.DitherAlgorithm. If this is given null, it instead does nothing.
        Specified by:
        setDitherAlgorithm in interface Dithered
        Parameters:
        ditherAlgorithm - which Dithered.DitherAlgorithm to use for upcoming output
      >>>>>>> master

      • addFrame

        public boolean addFrame​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap im)
        Adds next GIF frame. The frame is not written immediately, but is actually deferred until the next frame is received so that timing data can be inserted. Invoking finish() flushes all frames. If setSize was not invoked, the size of the first image is used for all subsequent frames.
        Parameters:
        im - BufferedImage containing frame to write.
        Returns:
        true if successful.

      • finish

        public boolean finish()
        Flushes any pending data and closes output file. If writing to an OutputStream, the stream is not closed.

      • setFrameRate

        public void setFrameRate​(float fps)
        Sets frame rate in frames per second. Equivalent to setDelay(1000.0f / fps).
        Parameters:
        fps - float frame rate (frames per second)

      • setSize

        public void setSize​(int w,
                    int h)
        Sets the GIF frame size. The default size is the size of the first frame added if this method is not invoked.
        Parameters:
        w - int frame width.
        h - int frame width.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets the GIF frame position. The position is 0,0 by default. Useful for only updating a section of the image
        Parameters:
        x - int frame x position.
        y - int frame y position.

      • start

        public boolean start​(java.io.OutputStream os)
        Initiates GIF file creation on the given stream. The stream is not closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        os - OutputStream on which GIF images are written.
        Returns:
        false if initial write failed.

        Analyzes image colors and creates color map.
